emails.subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is management via API possible in WEB VPM?
emails.body:
--6040003b0dcd60a444c2432a6f382c82ddd5ebe11202ca58408ffcb0635e Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii Mime-Version: 1.0 Hi Jinyoung Hong, Regarding your question please refer below for the answer: Q1) The existing Java VPM has changed to support WEB VPM. Is it possible to manage via API in WEB VPM? The ProxySG does not have APIs that fetch data from the ProxySG or=20 integrate with third-party products. Workaround :=20 1. Use the Management Center REST API. Management Center can connect to the ProxySG to apply changes.=20 See the documentation on the REST API: Management Center REST API =20 2. The ProxySG has a number of read-only advanced URL like=20 https://u4977512.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=3Du001.WYHhCPp6dEnKQnDFAdHxvs= tOJ24sP-2BSQkQkuo8rwTe4-3D4vpv_DDREOZ7NkpbYT4gPFrpV6d5nzaEVRBmZFrnK-2F6XR4a= c60Tzz3fuYsZ3QTyhRXZ2FCwDNCnact-2FViKu1EfvDbvnic6eIFWSs7gxrfYMrR-2FvScTevni= 8tyc85nzt4MbVdHVcn3Zaj-2BWndouG1s2BlLHUXbsibcx16A51UGilcTu-2Fyn4UalaXUQmM0i= gJw8MkeCKTi5I7rNUYxnaLI1Fj-2FnXw5359v48ry3HkapLOFklCg-3D:8082/sysinfo or=20 https://u4977512.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=3Du001.WYHhCPp6dEnKQnDFAdHxvs= tOJ24sP-2BSQkQkuo8rwTe4-3DPL1g_DDREOZ7NkpbYT4gPFrpV6d5nzaEVRBmZFrnK-2F6XR4a= c60Tzz3fuYsZ3QTyhRXZ2FCwDNCnact-2FViKu1EfvDbvtYaF-2B5GEeaEwTeT2ocfcfG2QJgo5= Mvz519Py97E-2F0gcF8FcKqUc76bLVRYZ8nYo66hgJa5lBqR3Vxh8PPMMg4FVb1EAucfjzw2JeV= iDseFmGDeY-2FMAgyg-2BBSHnBR6VRweOtoOTxHbRTWmD6A-2B-2FRwDg-3D:8082/policy/=20 These are not APIs but the URLs can be used to fetch information about the=20 proxy.=20 =20 3. The ProxySG's SSH interface can be utilized to make changes in the proxy= =20 configuration using the CLI. Using SSH it is possible to script commands=20 for automation.=20 Refer to the CLI documentation: ProxySG Command Line Reference ProxySG API to gather data and integrate with other reporting products Q2) Can't the policy be reflected in Excel format instead of XML format in=20 WEB VPM? Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel=20 format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is=20 structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and=20 MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding,=20 authentication and access with different format and function, it almost=20 impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and=20 column.=20 Regards, Fauzee --6040003b0dcd60a444c2432a6f382c82ddd5ebe11202ca58408ffcb0635e Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable Content-Type: text/html; charset=us-ascii Mime-Version: 1.0
Hi Jinyo= ung Hong,

Regarding your question please refer below for the answer:=

Q= 1) The existing Java VPM has changed to support WEB VPM.Is it possible to manage via API in WEB= VPM?

The ProxySG does not have APIs that fetch data = from the ProxySG or integrate with third-party products.

Workaround :=  

1. Use the Management Center REST API.


Management Ce= nter can connect to the ProxySG to apply changes. 

See the docum= entation on the REST API: Management Center REST API

 

2. The Proxy= SG has a number of read-only advanced URL like https://<ProxySG_IP_addre= ss>:8082/sysinfo or https://<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/policy/ = ;

These are not APIs but the URLs can be used to fetch information a= bout the proxy. 

 

3. The ProxySG's SSH interface can= be utilized to make changes in the proxy configuration using the CLI. Usin= g SSH it is possible to script commands for automation. 

Refer t= o the CLI documentation: ProxySG Command Lin= e Reference

ProxySG API to gather data and integrate with other re= porting products

Q2) Can't the policy be reflected in Excel format instea= d of XML format in WEB VPM?

Currently ProxySG do not= support the option to export policy to excel format. If you noticed before= , in the policy trace, the policy is structured as a line of command which = is check one by one with MISS and MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use= multiple layer like forwarding, authentication and access with different f= ormat and function, it almost impossible to create a general rule which can= fit into Excel row and column. 

Regards,
Fauzee
--6040003b0dcd60a444c2432a6f382c82ddd5ebe11202ca58408ffcb0635e--

emails.preview: This is a multi-part message in MIME format. ---=Part.48e4.b97b99c42720345b.19634e26cb2.e5d0157cda2a2d8b=- Content-Type: multipart/alternative;

emails.subject: RE: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is management via API possible in WEB VPM?
emails.body:
This is a multipart message in MIME format. ------=_NextPart_000_01B5_01DBAE21.02452000 Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary="----=_NextPart_001_01B6_01DBAE21.02452000" ------=_NextPart_001_01B6_01DBAE21.02452000 Content-Type: text/plain; charset="ks_c_5601-1987" Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit ------=_NextPart_001_01B6_01DBAE21.02452000 Content-Type: text/html; charset="ks_c_5601-1987" Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hi, Team

Thank you for your = support.

I was thinking the same thing about the contents, but I = opened a case because of the customer's request. For now, I understand = that both are impossible.
Q1) Are there any plans to support these in = the future?
Q2) Aren't only simple tasks such as creating and = modifying objects possible through REST API in MC? Can all the functions = provided by VPM be managed through REST = API?

Regards,

 

 

 

 

 

From:<= /b> = broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com = [mailto:broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com]
Sent: Monday, = April 14, 2025 3:58 PM
To: = kevin@etechsystem.co.kr
Cc: = symantec-blue@etechsystem.co.kr
Subject: {Case#80026785} = ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is management via API possible = in WEB VPM?

 

Hi Jinyoung Hong,

Regarding your question please = refer below for the answer:

Q= 1) The existing Java VPM has changed to support WEB = VPM.
Is it possible to = manage via API in WEB VPM?

The ProxySG = does not have APIs that fetch data from the ProxySG or integrate with = third-party products.

Workaround : 

1. Use the Management Center REST = API.


Management Center = can connect to the ProxySG to apply = changes. 

See the = documentation on the REST API: Management Center REST = API

 

2. The = ProxySG has a number of read-only advanced URL like = https://<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/sysinfo or = https://<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/policy/ 

These are = not APIs but the URLs can be used to fetch information about the = proxy. 

 

3. The = ProxySG's SSH interface can be utilized to make changes in the proxy = configuration using the CLI. Using SSH it is possible to script commands = for automation. 

Refer = to the CLI documentation: ProxySG Command Line = Reference

ProxySG API to = gather data and integrate with other reporting = products

Q= 2) Can't the policy be reflected in Excel format instead of XML format = in WEB VPM?<= br>
Currently ProxySG do not support = the option to export policy to excel format. If you noticed before, in = the policy trace, the policy is structured as a line of command which is = check one by one with MISS and MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use = multiple layer like forwarding, authentication and access with different = format and function, it almost impossible to create a general rule which = can fit into Excel row and = column. 

Regards,
Fauzee

The ProxySG has a number of read-only advanced URL like=20 https://u4977512.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=3Du001.WYHhCPp6dEnKQnDFAdHxvs= tOJ24sP-2BSQkQkuo8rwTe4-3D5Erj_DDREOZ7NkpbYT4gPFrpV6d5nzaEVRBmZFrnK-2F6XR4a= c60Tzz3fuYsZ3QTyhRXZ2F78v6ZZKlLa8SCUfhjXNMoAVTJ6xpAGuJdyyHBItuPPXrOJKxJgl9F= Aa-2B5lwKTrHV7FNx0RjVh-2BJFBBrk1ZI6Kb-2Bpv-2F2Dvth-2FWWWH-2F0zOtWsg1PGTH-2B= -2BYiiPClTKmb8UjHZ2OwNDv7xbaaJa4LF1BxN-2FSAhAI7j1szIpi0oApfvA-3D:8082/sysinfo or=20 https://u4977512.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=3Du001.WYHhCPp6dEnKQnDFAdHxvs= tOJ24sP-2BSQkQkuo8rwTe4-3DHFm0_DDREOZ7NkpbYT4gPFrpV6d5nzaEVRBmZFrnK-2F6XR4a= c60Tzz3fuYsZ3QTyhRXZ2F78v6ZZKlLa8SCUfhjXNMoIhf-2Br8Af2weUK2hUE-2Bi0Jjkcze2P= SAklPMun4V05LvThof37P398Y1cDfOTIir3Gu5m4Sr4hGkpaejvVHjwnmn-2FkgrIAsDhQTihQc= PclWz-2F6hsgeM5vW6yVFIbnoPNVXvG9-2Fe3re66OkIXQoajd614-3D:8082/policy/=20 These are not APIs but the URLs can be used to fetch information about the=20 proxy.=20 =20 3. The ProxySG's SSH interface can be utilized to make changes in the proxy= =20 configuration using the CLI. Using SSH it is possible to script commands=20 for automation.=20 Refer to the CLI documentation: ProxySG Command Line Reference ProxySG API to gather data and integrate with other reporting products Q2) Can't the policy be reflected in Excel format instead of XML format in=20 WEB VPM? Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel=20 format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is=20 structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and=20 MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding,=20 authentication and access with different format and function, it almost=20 impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and=20 column.=20 Regards, Fauzee [image.png] --da4da89ccd1c472f6073d4d9ad914a7eacf10c603416eec87cf586f70f26 Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8 Mime-Version: 1.0

NOTE: This= email was received from an external source. If there is anything suspiciou= s or unusual about this email please DO NOT open any attachments or click any links and repo= rt the email using the Report Message button.

Hi, Team

Thank you for you= r support.

I was thinking the same thing about the contents, but I o= pened a case because of the customer's request. For now, I understand that = both are impossible.
Q1) Are there any plans to support these in the fut= ure?
Q2) Aren't only simple tasks such as creating and modifying objects= possible through REST API in MC? Can all the functions provided by VPM be = managed through REST API?

Regards,

 

 <= /p>

 <= /span>

 

 

<= p class=3D"MsoNormal">From: broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.c= om [mailto:broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com]
Sent: = Monday, April 14, 2025 3:58 PM
To: kevin@etechsystem.co= ..kr
Cc: symantec-blue@etechsystem.co.kr
Subj= ect: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is = management via API possible in WEB VPM?

&n= bsp;

Hi Jinyoung Hong,

Regarding your= question please refer below for the answer:

Q1) Th= e existing Java VPM has changed to support WEB VPM.
Is it possible t= o manage via API in WEB VPM?

The ProxySG does = not have APIs that fetch data from the ProxySG or integrate with third-part= y products.

Workaround : 

1. Use the Management Center RES= T API.


Management Center can connect to the ProxySG to apply chan= ges. 

See the documentation on the REST API: Management Center REST API

 

2. The ProxySG has a number of read-only advanced URL like https://<Pro= xySG_IP_address>:8082/sysinfo or https://<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082= /policy/ 

These are not APIs but the URLs can be used to fetch = information about the proxy. 

 

3. The ProxySG's SSH = interface can be utilized to make changes in the proxy configuration using = the CLI. Using SSH it is possible to script commands for automation. <= /p>

Refer to the CLI documentation: ProxySG Command Line Re= ference

ProxySG API to gather data and integrate with other = reporting products

Q2) Can't the policy be refl= ected in Excel format instead of XML format in WEB VPM?

Currently ProxySG do not support the o= ption to export policy to excel format. If you noticed before, in the polic= y trace, the policy is structured as a line of command which is check one b= y one with MISS and MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple laye= r like forwarding, authentication and access with different format and func= tion, it almost impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Exce= l row and column. 

Regards,
Fauzee

emails.threadKey: {case#80026785} ##high - p2 - samsung electronics co,.ltd-is management via api possible in web vpm?

emails.subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is management via API possible in WEB VPM?
emails.body:
--2e469bf54abb080e8f0dd16b99c05a735641742f0f80375ff4030db4f434 Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary=24d8629c679a0ec3671b6c043f7282f0d84fc032cf0e4343ea6f2c78debf --24d8629c679a0ec3671b6c043f7282f0d84fc032cf0e4343ea6f2c78debf Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii Mime-Version: 1.0 Hi Jinyoung Hong, I have check with Broadcom Engineer regarding the question below and below=20 are the answer: Q1) Are there any plans to support these in the future? -For ProxySG web API, there are no plan to support this feature in the=20 future -For exporting the policy to Excel format, there already FR for this=20 feature, but there is no plan to add this feature for now. Q2) Aren't only simple tasks such as creating and modifying objects=20 possible through REST API in MC? Can all the functions provided by VPM be=20 managed through REST API? -For REST API, you can use it to do below function, however this required=20 the proxy to be connected to the Management Center.=20 * Access and raise alerts. * View registered devices, device health, and other monitoring variables. * View jobs and job execution status. * Create, edit, schedule, and execute jobs. * Show basic device information like version, disk usage, and name of device. * Manage devices using the device CLI or device scripts. * Manage policy, including creating new objects, changing the policy content, and installing policy on a device. * Manage MC settings, and return system sensors and monitors. Regards, Fauzee ------------------------------------------------------------------------ =20 Hi Jinyoung Hong, Please give me some time to check this with Broadcom documentation. I will=20 update you once I found the related answer. Regards, Fauzee ------------------------------------------------------------------------ NOTE: This email was received from an external source. If there is anything suspicious or unusual about this email please DO NOT open any attachments or click any links and report the email using the Report Message button. Hi, Team Thank you for your support. I was thinking the same thing about the contents, but I opened a case=20 because of the customer's request. For now, I understand that both are=20 impossible. Q1) Are there any plans to support these in the future? Q2) Aren't only simple tasks such as creating and modifying objects=20 possible through REST API in MC? Can all the functions provided by VPM be=20 managed through REST API? Regards, =20 =20 [image.png] =20 =20 =20 From: broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com=20 [mailto:broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com] Sent: Monday, April 14, 2025 3:58 PM To: kevin@etechsystem.co.kr Cc: symantec-blue@etechsystem.co.kr Subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is=20 management via API possible in WEB VPM? =20 Hi Jinyoung Hong, Regarding your question please refer below for the answer: Q1) The existing Java VPM has changed to support WEB VPM. Is it possible to manage via API in WEB VPM? The ProxySG does not have APIs that fetch data from the ProxySG or=20 integrate with third-party products. Workaround :=20 1. Use the Management Center REST API. Management Center can connect to the ProxySG to apply changes.=20 See the documentation on the REST API: Management Center REST API =20 2. The ProxySG has a number of read-only advanced URL like=20 https://u4977512.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=3Du001.WYHhCPp6dEnKQnDFAdHxvs= tOJ24sP-2BSQkQkuo8rwTe4-3D5c31_DDREOZ7NkpbYT4gPFrpV6d5nzaEVRBmZFrnK-2F6XR4a= c60Tzz3fuYsZ3QTyhRXZ2FhPAXybyUk0c-2FaKJPV8TfMIgBhsBCVlD5zyimq5VtSy9ZjJBhqth= 7eIt-2FMiWx5-2F14KOhmt9dkFuZ24wsAR0xSqslePWtjaaWZllOEZzjedBPVz6d08WlkqpCkSy= -2FPAVh7wt3DmraeODgy4k7qERhj-2FsN9CBLh3XD9sMwZizuEjw0-3D:8082/sysinfo or=20 https://u4977512.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=3Du001.WYHhCPp6dEnKQnDFAdHxvs= tOJ24sP-2BSQkQkuo8rwTe4-3Dr64d_DDREOZ7NkpbYT4gPFrpV6d5nzaEVRBmZFrnK-2F6XR4a= c60Tzz3fuYsZ3QTyhRXZ2FhPAXybyUk0c-2FaKJPV8TfMCH883ZVVyZzjrL3nIXb185OfHp8ah4= B2Z6lDJFypwsS8DIvrsBZhnKzwQFGCciAyw9iROCpSMwVWxb8jGRrNvbGPBYcWviCmaahm80o-2= BPuOg8HTTgj0wJam07M66WAnwGpnnCYL3DTZFQbl7BK7lmE-3D:8082= /policy/=20 These are not APIs but the URLs can be used to fetch information about the=20 proxy.=20 =20 3. The ProxySG's SSH interface can be utilized to make changes in the proxy= =20 configuration using the CLI. Using SSH it is possible to script commands=20 for automation.=20 Refer to the CLI documentation: ProxySG Command Line Reference ProxySG API to gather data and integrate with other reporting products Q2) Can't the policy be reflected in Excel format instead of XML format in=20 WEB VPM? = Hi Jinyoung Hong,


I have check with Broadcom Engineer regarding = the question below and below are the answer:

Q1) Are there any plans to support these in the future?

-For Prox= ySG web API, there are no plan to support this feature in the future

-For exporting the policy to Excel format, there already = FR for this feature, but there is no plan to add this feature for now.

Q2) Aren't only simple ta= sks such as creating and modifying objects possible through REST API in MC?= Can all the functions provided by VPM be managed through REST API?

-For REST API, you can use it to do below function, however this re= quired the proxy to be connected to the Management Center. 

  • Access and raise alerts.
    • View registered devices, device health, and other monitoring = variables.
  • View jobs and job execution = status.
  • Create, edit, schedule, and exe= cute jobs.
  • Show basic device informatio= n like version, disk usage, and name of device.
  • Manage devices using the device CLI or device scripts.
  • Manage policy, including creating new objects, cha= nging the policy content, and installing policy on a device.
    =
  • Manage MC settings, and return system sensors and mon= itors.


Regards,
Fauzee

Hi Jinyoung Hong,

Regarding your= question please refer below for the answer:

Q1) Th= e existing Java VPM has changed to support WEB VPM.
Is it possible t= o manage via API in WEB VPM?

The ProxySG does = not have APIs that fetch data from the ProxySG or integrate with third-part= y products.

Workaround : 

1. Use the Management Center RES= T API.


Management Center can connect to the ProxySG to apply chan= ges. 

See the documentation on the REST API: Management Center REST API

 

2. The ProxySG has a number of read-only advanced URL like https://<Pro= xySG_IP_address>:8082/sysinfo or https://<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082= /policy/ 

These are not APIs but the URLs can be used to fetch = information about the proxy. 

 

3. The ProxySG's SSH = interface can be utilized to make changes in the proxy configuration using = the CLI. Using SSH it is possible to script commands for automation. <= /p>

Refer to the CLI documentation: ProxySG Command Line Re= ference

ProxySG API to gather data and integrate with other = reporting products

Q2) Can't the policy be refl= ected in Excel format instead of XML format in WEB VPM?

Currently ProxySG do not support the o= ption to export policy to excel format. If you noticed before, in the polic= y trace, the policy is structured as a line of command which is check one b= y one with MISS and MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple laye= r like forwarding, authentication and access with different format and func= tion, it almost impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Exce= l row and column. 

Regards,
Fauzee

You said that you can create new objects,=20 change policy contents, etc. through MC,2) I have another question. You=20 said that you can create new objects, change policy contents, etc. through=20 MC, but is it possible to operate it with only the currently provided REST API=20 as in VPM? Please answer with this focus. REST API are only working on Management Center, you can create script to=20 make management center to create policy/object and push the policy install=20 to the proxy device. It does not directly interact with VPM in proxy. Regards, Fauzee ------------------------------------------------------------------------ NOTE: This email was received from an external source. Hi, Team =20 Q1) Is it possible to export policies in Excel format instead of XML format= =20 and install them in Excel format? QQ2) I have another question. You said that you can create new objects,=20 change policy contents, etc. through MC,2) I have another question. You=20 said that you can create new objects, change policy contents, etc. through=20 MC, but is it possible to operate it with only the currently provided REST API=20 as in VPM? Please answer with this focus. =20 Regards, =20 =20 [image.png] =20 =20 =20 From: broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com=20 [mailto:broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com] Sent: Wednesday, April 16, 2025 3:06 PM To: dsp0701@etechsystem.co.kr; kevin@etechsystem.co.kr Cc: symantec-blue@etechsystem.co.kr; broadcomsupport.apac@westcon.com Subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is=20 management via API possible in WEB VPM? =20 Hi Jinyoung Hong, I have check with Broadcom Engineer regarding the question below and below=20 are the answer: Q1) Are there any plans to support these in the future? -For ProxySG web API, there are no plan to support this feature in the=20 future -For exporting the policy to Excel format, there already FR for this=20 feature, but there is no plan to add this feature for now. Q2) Aren't only simple tasks such as creating and modifying objects=20 possible through REST API in MC? Can all the functions provided by VPM be=20 managed through REST API? -For REST API, you can use it to do below function, however this required=20 the proxy to be connected to the Management Center.=20 * Access and raise alerts. * View registered devices, device health, and other monitoring variables. * View jobs and job execution status. * Create, edit, schedule, and execute jobs. * Show basic device information like version, disk usage, and name of device. * Manage devices using the device CLI or device scripts. * Manage policy, including creating new objects, changing the policy content, and installing policy on a device. * Manage MC settings, and return system sensors and monitors. Regards, Fauzee =20 =20 Hi Jinyoung Hong, Please give me some time to check this with Broadcom documentation. I will=20 update you once I found the related answer. Regards, Fauzee =20 =20 NOTE: This email was received from an external source. If there is anything= =20 suspicious or unusual about this email please DO NOT open any attachments=20 or click any links and report the email using the Report Message button. =20 Hi, Team Thank you for your support. I was thinking the same thing about the contents, but I opened a case=20 because of the customer's request. For now, I understand that both are=20 impossible. Q1) Are there any plans to support these in the future? Q2) Aren't only simple tasks such as creating and modifying objects=20 possible through REST API in MC? Can all the functions provided by VPM be=20 managed through REST API? Regards, =20 =20 [image.png] =20 =20 =20 From: broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com=20 [mailto:broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com] Sent: Monday, April 14, 2025 3:58 PM To: kevin@etechsystem.co.kr Cc: symantec-blue@etechsystem.co.kr Subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is=20 management via API possible in WEB VPM? =20 Hi Jinyoung Hong, Regarding your question please refer below for the answer: Q1) The existing Java VPM has changed to support WEB VPM. Is it possible to manage via API in WEB VPM? The ProxySG does not have APIs that fetch data from the ProxySG or=20 integrate with third-party products. Workaround :=20 1. Use the Management Center REST API. Management Center can connect to the ProxySG to apply changes.=20 See the documentation on the REST API: Management Center REST API =20 2. The ProxySG has a number of read-only advanced URL like=20 https://u4977512.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=3Du001.WYHhCPp6dEnKQnDFAdHxvs= tOJ24sP-2BSQkQkuo8rwTe4-3Dv7SI_DDREOZ7NkpbYT4gPFrpV6d5nzaEVRBmZFrnK-2F6XR4a= c60Tzz3fuYsZ3QTyhRXZ2FHSCHKODK9nZTBWfYor53cDVXtFe5fOAjThV22I7ZwpgW87MDAu5Xx= nuI-2FQDzW7pE4hh1A-2FEvmmEeLZLVi5jOgHH0WGxTcT18s40bRwIEtPRbCXG8JvGQq8e6joI8= llcrjo8BiKwVTOStY-2FHvPELyfRbS9ulUVoyK9Mtzew-2BVqoU-3D:= 8082/sysinfo or=20 https://u4977512.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=3Du001.WYHhCPp6dEnKQnDFAdHxvs= tOJ24sP-2BSQkQkuo8rwTe4-3DGw3A_DDREOZ7NkpbYT4gPFrpV6d5nzaEVRBmZFrnK-2F6XR4a= c60Tzz3fuYsZ3QTyhRXZ2FHSCHKODK9nZTBWfYor53cENBL5qWtCXCgvjP6Udj7iMUoMvlFZC1C= 7DxpLKhhtAqOt2TtBDQseGyNmO69KxhwoKKxVrlcC-2BAP-2B9p7-2B-2FB5ThWOoV8TWeV5C2y= wIzLl8cNqwDBzHnMs9K13u86sgE2yDyVNce4oxhsKCxQjrGVB6E-3D:= 8082/policy/=20 These are not APIs but the URLs can be used to fetch information about the=20 proxy.=20 =20 3. The ProxySG's SSH interface can be utilized to make changes in the proxy= =20 configuration using the CLI. Using SSH it is possible to script commands=20 for automation.=20 Refer to the CLI documentation: ProxySG Command Line Reference ProxySG API to gather data and integrate with other reporting products Q2) Can't the policy be reflected in Excel format instead of XML format in=20 WEB VPM? Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel=20 format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is=20 structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and=20 MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding,=20 authentication and access with different format and function, it almost=20 impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and=20 column.=20 Regards, Fauzee [image.png] [image.png] --bd174716cd050f5e5cc22ad67c65b155342702f9174c5e3999f6e015004d Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8 Mime-Version: 1.0

Hi, Team

 

Q1) Is it possible to export policies in Excel format instead of XML= format and install them in Excel format?

QQ2) I have another question. You said that you can c= reate new objects, change policy contents, etc. through MC,2) I have= another question. You said that you can create new objects, change policy = contents, etc. through MC,

but is it possible to= operate it with only the currently provided REST API as in VPM? Please ans= wer with this focus.

 

Regards,

Subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 = - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is management via API possible in WEB VPM?

 

Hi Jinyoung Hong,
=

I have check with Broadcom Engineer regarding the question below an= d below are the answer:

Q1) Are= there any plans to support these in the future?

-For ProxySG web API, there are no plan to support this f= eature in the future

-For exporting the policy to Excel format= , there already FR for this feature, but there is no plan to add this featu= re for now.

<= /span>Q2) Aren't only simple tasks such as creating and modifying objects p= ossible through REST API in MC? Can all the functions provided by VPM be ma= naged through REST API?

-For REST API, you can use it to do below function, ho= wever this required the proxy to be connected to the Management Center.&nbs= p;

  • Access and raise alerts.
  • View registered devices, device health, and= other monitoring variables.
  • View jobs and job execution status.<= /strong>
  • Create= , edit, schedule, and execute jobs.
  • Show basic device information like ve= rsion, disk usage, and name of device.
    • =
    • Manage devices using the device CLI= or device scripts.
      <= li class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"mso-margin-top-alt: auto; mso-margin-bottom= -alt: auto; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1;">Manage policy, including creating new objects, changin= g the policy content, and installing policy on a device.
    • Manage MC setting= s, and return system sensors and monitors.
    <= /div>


    Regards,
    Fauzee

    Hi Jinyoung Hong,

    Please give me some time to check this wit= h Broadcom documentation. I will update you once I found the related answer= ..

    NOTE: This email was received from an external source. If there is anything su= spicious or unusual about this email please DO NOT open any attachments or click any links and rep= ort the email using the Report Message button.

     

    Hi, Team

    Thank you for your support.=

    I was thinking the same thing about the contents, but I opened a ca= se because of the customer's request. For now, I understand that both are i= mpossible.
    Q1) Are there any plans to support these in the future?
    Q2= ) Aren't only simple tasks such as creating and modifying objects possible = through REST API in MC? Can all the functions provided by VPM be managed th= rough REST API?

    Regards,

     

     

     

     

    From:= broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com [mailto:broadcomsupport@apaccms.westco= n.com]
    Sent:= Monday, April 14, 2025 3:58 PM
    To: kevin@etechsystem.co= ..kr
    Cc: symantec-blue@etechsystem.co.kr
    Subject: {Case#80026785} ##Hi= gh - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is management via API possible in WEB= VPM?

     

    Hi Jinyoung Hong,<= br>
    Regarding your question please refer below for the answer:

    Q1) The existing Java VPM has changed to support WEB VPM.
    Is it possible to manage via API in WEB VPM?

    The ProxySG does not have APIs that fetch data from the ProxySG or inte= grate with third-party products.

    Workaround : 

    1. Use the = Management Center REST API.


    Management Center can connect to the = ProxySG to apply changes. 

    See the documentation on the REST API= : Management Center REST API

     

    2. The ProxySG has a number of read-only advanced URL= like https://<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/sysinfo or https://<ProxyS= G_IP_address>:8082/policy/ 

    These are not APIs but the URLs = can be used to fetch information about the proxy. 

     

    = 3. The ProxySG's SSH interface can be utilized to make changes in the proxy= configuration using the CLI. Using SSH it is possible to script commands f= or automation. 

    Refer to the CLI documentation: Pr= oxySG Command Line Reference

    ProxySG API to gather data and integrate = with other reporting products

    Q2) Can't the pol= icy be reflected in Excel format instead of XML format in WEB VPM?

    Currently ProxySG do not su= pport the option to export policy to excel format. If you noticed before, i= n the policy trace, the policy is structured as a line of command which is = check one by one with MISS and MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use mu= ltiple layer like forwarding, authentication and access with different form= at and function, it almost impossible to create a general rule which can fi= t into Excel row and column. 

    Regards,
    Fauzee

--68fc76ef52ad75a4424e4f07572470250a136cdcb8fdb4625ddd55d99e51 Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary=d23a460cf570b665cb5b99e0259776a870bdbfa471feca1a7ec0731da986 --d23a460cf570b665cb5b99e0259776a870bdbfa471feca1a7ec0731da986 Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii Mime-Version: 1.0 Hi Team, Please refer below for my answer. (Q)I wonder if I can do all the actions currently managed through VPM when=20 using Proxy through REST API. For example, is it possible to do detailed settings and Enable/Disable for=20 the 100th Rule through API? I wonder if all management is possible through=20 REST API even without using VPM. (A)-You can use this API if you want to access Management Center without=20 using the UI or want to trigger Management Center operation without using=20 the UI. This REST API has the ability to: * Access and raise alerts. * View registered devices, device health, and other monitoring variables. * View jobs and job execution status. * Create, edit, schedule, and execute jobs. * Show basic device information like version, disk usage, and name of device. * Manage devices using the device CLI or device scripts. * Manage policy, including creating new objects, changing the policy content, and installing policy on a device. * Manage MC settings, and return system sensors and monitors. Please refer below KB for more information on REST API. Management Center REST API (Q)Additionally, you said that you can extract the policy into Excel. Please tell me how to do that and also answer the question about whether it= =20 is impossible to insert the policy into Excel. (A)-Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel=20 format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is=20 structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and=20 MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding,=20 authentication and access with different format and function, it almost=20 impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and=20 column.=20 -For exporting the policy to Excel format, there already FR for this=20 feature, but there is no plan to add this feature for now. Regard, Fauzee ------------------------------------------------------------------------ NOTE: This email was received from an external source. If there is anything suspicious or unusual about this email please DO NOT open any attachments or click any links and report the email using the Report Message button. Hi, Team =20 You said that you will not provide Proxy API in the future, I wonder if I can do all the actions currently managed through VPM when=20 using Proxy through REST API. For example, is it possible to do detailed settings and Enable/Disable for=20 the 100th Rule through API? I wonder if all management is possible through=20 REST API even without using VPM. =20 Additionally, you said that you can extract the policy into Excel. Please tell me how to do that and also answer the question about whether it= =20 is impossible to insert the policy into Excel. =20 Regards, =20 =20 [image.png] =20 =20 =20 From: broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com=20 [mailto:broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com] Sent: Thursday, April 17, 2025 4:00 PM To: dsp0701@etechsystem.co.kr; kevin@etechsystem.co.kr Cc: symantec-blue@etechsystem.co.kr; broadcomsupport.apac@westcon.com Subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is=20 management via API possible in WEB VPM? =20 Hi Team, For the question below: QQ2) I have another question. You said that you can create new objects,=20 change policy contents, etc. through MC,2) I have another question. You=20 said that you can create new objects, change policy contents, etc. through=20 MC, but is it possible to operate it with only the currently provided REST API=20 as in VPM? Please answer with this focus. REST API are only working on Management Center, you can create script to=20 make management center to create policy/object and push the policy install=20 to the proxy device. It does not directly interact with VPM in proxy. Regards, Fauzee =20 =20 NOTE: This email was received from an external source. If there is anything= =20 suspicious or unusual about this email please DO NOT open any attachments=20 or click any links and report the email using the Report Message button. =20 Hi, Team =20 Q1) Is it possible to export policies in Excel format instead of XML format= =20 and install them in Excel format? QQ2) I have another question. You said that you can create new objects,=20 change policy contents, etc. through MC,2) I have another question. You=20 said that you can create new objects, change policy contents, etc. through=20 MC, but is it possible to operate it with only the currently provided REST API=20 as in VPM? Please answer with this focus. =20 Regards, =20 =20 [image.png] =20 =20 =20 From: broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com=20 [mailto:broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com] Sent: Wednesday, April 16, 2025 3:06 PM To: dsp0701@etechsystem.co.kr; kevin@etechsystem.co.kr Cc: symantec-blue@etechsystem.co.kr; broadcomsupport.apac@westcon.com Subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is=20 management via API possible in WEB VPM? =20 Hi Jinyoung Hong, I have check with Broadcom Engineer regarding the question below and below=20 are the answer: Q1) Are there any plans to support these in the future? -For ProxySG web API, there are no plan to support this feature in the=20 future -For exporting the policy to Excel format, there already FR for this=20 feature, but there is no plan to add this feature for now. Q2) Aren't only simple tasks such as creating and modifying objects=20 possible through REST API in MC? Can all the functions provided by VPM be=20 managed through REST API? -For REST API, you can use it to do below function, however this required=20 the proxy to be connected to the Management Center.=20 * Access and raise alerts. * View registered devices, device health, and other monitoring variables. * View jobs and job execution status. * Create, edit, schedule, and execute jobs. * Show basic device information like version, disk usage, and name of device. * Manage devices using the device CLI or device scripts. * Manage policy, including creating new objects, changing the policy content, and installing policy on a device. * Manage MC settings, and return system sensors and monitors. Regards, Fauzee =20 =20 Hi Jinyoung Hong, Please give me some time to check this with Broadcom documentation. I will=20 update you once I found the related answer. Regards, Fauzee =20 =20 NOTE: This email was received from an external source. If there is anything= =20 suspicious or unusual about this email please DO NOT open any attachments=20 or click any links and report the email using the Report Message button. =20 Hi, Team Thank you for your support. I was thinking the same thing about the contents, but I opened a case=20 because of the customer's request. For now, I understand that both are=20 impossible. Q1) Are there any plans to support these in the future? Q2) Aren't only simple tasks such as creating and modifying objects=20 possible through REST API in MC? Can all the functions provided by VPM be=20 managed through REST API? Regards, =20 =20 [image.png] =20 =20 =20 From: broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com=20 [mailto:broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com] Sent: Monday, April 14, 2025 3:58 PM To: kevin@etechsystem.co.kr Cc: symantec-blue@etechsystem.co.kr Subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is=20 management via API possible in WEB VPM? =20 Hi Jinyoung Hong, Regarding your question please refer below for the answer: Q1) The existing Java VPM has changed to support WEB VPM. Is it possible to manage via API in WEB VPM? The ProxySG does not have APIs that fetch data from the ProxySG or=20 integrate with third-party products. Workaround :=20 1. Use the Management Center REST API. Management Center can connect to the ProxySG to apply changes.=20 See the documentation on the REST API: Management Center REST API =20 2. The ProxySG has a number of read-only advanced URL like=20 https://u4977512.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=3Du001.WYHhCPp6dEnKQnDFAdHxvs= tOJ24sP-2BSQkQkuo8rwTe4-3Dl6IP_DDREOZ7NkpbYT4gPFrpV6d5nzaEVRBmZFrnK-2F6XR4a= c60Tzz3fuYsZ3QTyhRXZ2F-2BKz6ExEKY-2FJlI-2F6WLct33hA3WdBchFHdM3XOh2nsUYLu-2F= -2BXS-2B6kK8glSVbB5x7noyRK-2FrHfxzBqv6UPNRUaIh9BpACjJ0FODKVfhzIzjtcbktOgKC-= 2Bhoqwh3zt7JMRXBCuzE9oz87CEWg-2BdxPZRYNIq8Onsa4OTvmlfok4HaRGk-3D:8082/sysinfo or=20 https://u4977512.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=3Du001.WYHhCPp6dEnKQnDFAdHxvs= tOJ24sP-2BSQkQkuo8rwTe4-3DAVc7_DDREOZ7NkpbYT4gPFrpV6d5nzaEVRBmZFrnK-2F6XR4a= c60Tzz3fuYsZ3QTyhRXZ2F-2BKz6ExEKY-2FJlI-2F6WLct33j7-2BktIv4INV4DJAxQk2qsVp-= 2FB95HG6xYtrGuhDZ-2Bduapmek0K1Saky6-2Fvem-2BJyAHi3nWy-2BS-2BAQdRFqxeyMYMQRh= fzA29hQ0kMd6Um0FInmWewEGKWEg-2BpZSCDYMAS0yjSeH6H1WBJqSzUurMkrS140-3D:8082/policy/=20 These are not APIs but the URLs can be used to fetch information about the=20 proxy.=20 =20 3. The ProxySG's SSH interface can be utilized to make changes in the proxy= =20 configuration using the CLI. Using SSH it is possible to script commands=20 for automation.=20 Refer to the CLI documentation: ProxySG Command Line Reference ProxySG API to gather data and integrate with other reporting products Q2) Can't the policy be reflected in Excel format instead of XML format in=20 WEB VPM? Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel=20 format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is=20 structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and=20 MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding,=20 authentication and access with different format and function, it almost=20 impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and=20 column.=20 Regards, Fauzee [image.png] [image.png] [image.png] --d23a460cf570b665cb5b99e0259776a870bdbfa471feca1a7ec0731da986 Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8 Mime-Version: 1.0

= Hi Team,

Please refer below for my answer.

(Q)I wonder if I ca= n do all the actions currently managed through VPM when using Proxy through= REST API.

For example, is it possible to do detailed settings and En= able/Disable for the 100th Rule through API? I wonder if all management is = possible through REST API even without using VPM.

(A)-You can use thi= s API if you want to access Management Center without using th= e UI or want to trigger Management Center operation with= out using the UI. This REST API has the ability to:

  • Access and raise alerts.
  • View registered devices, dev= ice health, and other monitoring variables.
  • View jobs an= d job execution status.
  • Create, edit, schedule, and exec= ute jobs.
  • Show basic device information like version, di= sk usage, and name of device.
  • Manage devices using the d= evice CLI or device scripts.
  • Manage policy, incl= uding creating new objects, changing the policy content, and installing pol= icy on a device.
  • Manage MC settings, and return= system sensors and monitors.

    • Please refer below KB for more information on REST API.
    Management Center REST API

    (Q)Additionally, you said that you c= an extract the policy into Excel.

    Please tell me how to do that and also answer the question about whether= it is impossible to insert the policy into Excel.

    (A)-Currently ProxySG do not support the option = to export policy to excel format. If you noticed before, in the po= licy trace, the policy is structured as a line of command which is check on= e by one with MISS and MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use mu= ltiple layer like forwarding, authentication and access with diffe= rent format and function, it almost impossible to create a general = rule which can fit into Excel row and column. 

    = -For exporting the policy to Excel format, there already FR for thi= s feature, but there is no plan to add this feature for now.
    Regard,
    Fauzee
